result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • John G Armstrong was found guilty of OWI (7th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Consec to any other sentence currently serving. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
9/4/15 Crt amends JOC to reflect 0 days credit (prev 51)

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $1519  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent in writing & functioning IID.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MM. Not use or possess alcohol. Not be on on the premises of any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell alcohol. No alcohol in the residence in which he resides.
Sobrietor for first 6 mo of extended supervision.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-prev provided per DCSO.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.
